website_summaries.verdict: A wonderful collection of insightful stories and dog-training advice from Dog Whisperer Cesar Millan.
pros: Provides interesting facts about pack mentality and fun anecdotes in addition to training tips and advice
Focuses on training both puppies and adult dogs
Well-written content is easy to read
Book gives good insight into how dogs think
cons: Book focuses more on helpful stories and advice rather than step-by-step instructions

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend this book for anyone who wishes to get a puppy, already has a puppy or even has an adolescent dog!
customer_reviews.text: Great book, easy read and it has changed our lives as we raise our puppies. Thank you Cesar - only wished we picked up this book before we even got our puppies as there is so much knowledge and helps us also understand our puppies behavior and how we can make their lives and our lives all the more better. customer_reviews.title: A Rip-off book about puppies.
customer_reviews.text: This book is a waste of money. It’s a book mechanically produced under the Cesar Millan brand. First, it is basically all about puppies, so there is not much about dog training. Second, there is no useful advice. I wanted to stop my 2 year old dog from barking. It said the best approach was never to let my puppy bark. Cesar made his money and fame from whispering to dogs, so maybe he doesn’t want to let the rest of the world in on his secret. But he should just say so out front rather than ripping off people with products like this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Zielinski

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality book contains good information.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book as a Christmas gift for a relative who will be getting a puppy and watches Cesar's TV show. The book itself is rather poor quality, made with cheap paper, but the information it contains is what is important. Cesar gives some excellent advice and training theory for puppies, which, to me, the WHY behind what one is supposed to do is as critical, or even more so, than the xyz of training. The recipient was super thrilled with the book. Recommended to anyone who will be getting a puppy!!
customer_reviews.author: Roget

customer_reviews.title: Old Dog Caesar needs to learn a new trick
customer_reviews.text: Choppy organization. Long winded. Doesn’t address the inevitable “what if” I tried the advice and it doesn’t work. Mostly a rehash of his “pack leader” mantra. Seemed like Caesar is just trying to cash in on old stories of his experience. Most of this also hinges on the perfect situation, as in, I picked the perfect puppy for my lifestyle and it had the perfect parents, and it’s path to me followed your advice perfectly... guess what, that never happens. Tell me what to do with an imperfect situation and I’ll consider buying another book from you.

customer_reviews.title: Great book on how to approach your relationship with a new puppy from the beginning. Patience is key!
customer_reviews.text: Cesar Millan is fantastic. The one thing he preaches is patience. If you apply his methods consistently and patiently you will not be disappointed. This approach is a life-long commitment and can easily be combined with rewards-based training for fantastic results. Do not expect this book to "fix" your puppy. But this book is fantastic as a way to look at your relationship with your dog and make sure that you are fulfilling your puppy's needs. In turn, your puppy will then fulfill your needs, but that cannot be accomplished without trust, respect, boundaries, and patience.

customer_reviews.title: OK, But Not Great.

Cesar speaks a lot about things like "creating invisible fences", "calm assertiveness", and "energy", but unfortunately, he doesn't do a good job of defining these terms. There are a few concrete techniques scattered here and there throughout the book that I found to be useful, but if you are looking for a "how to train your puppy manual", I don't think this is it.

customer_reviews.title: A must-read before selecting a new puppy.

This book has lots of hands on techniques and tips that are perfect for the first time dog owner like me. I'm happy I purchased it, and have implemented many techniques with my dog.

customer_reviews.title: A good start, but not exhaustive
customer_reviews.text: If you are planning to get a puppy in the future, I would recommend reading through this book and keeping in mind anything that sounds like a good idea. I did not agree with everything, and sometimes it goes so far as to be weird, but on the whole, it will give you a better understanding of training your puppy to be a healthy companion. He also gives ideas and resources to help you along your way. I would recommend reading this after deciding to get a puppy, but before bringing it home, maybe even before deciding which dog is right for you.

Since we missed those few weeks, half the book was kinda depressing. Cesar Millan says himself that you can condition a dog at any age. This book wasn't so helpful for us.
